SPOM.content: Marx “deconstruct[s] what resembles a speculative edification [re: Stirner]” by suggesting the resemblance to Christ is an identification, Marx takes apart a “construction”

if every specter is distinguished from spirit by a quasi-incarnation, an incorporation, then Christ is most spectral of specters > greatest and most “incomprehensible of ghosts (unbegreiflichste Gespenst)”: no concept of incarnation w/out Jesus [Gespenst: Man-God (der Gottmensch)]
Christic moment, eucharistic instance, hyperbole of acharnement itself?

man, most unheimlich of all ghosts, if Christ (absolute specter) causes fear and pain, man causes even more—man makes himself fear (se fait peur), becomes fear he inspires > thus contradictions of all humanism

DPi.content: [w/ Genet] condemned to death becomes parody, comedy, imitation of Christ
in fighting for abolition, Hugo is both Father incarnated in Jesus (father as martyr defending son) & also the Son, Christ, the true reincarnated victim
medicalization is Christic, medicalization of justice (balm/oil replace iron/fire) is done in the figure, history & narrative of Christ
how long will DP survive Holy Father in Catholic church, how to measure time of the Son’s agony [?] (p. 276 Son’s agony, question of survival, blood in filiation)

nursing no illusion should not prevent us from being militant, this is composure (le sang-froid), courage, militate w/ cool heads (de sang-froid) [Derrida occupying position of the condemned and the abolitionist], grace, passion, love, J.C., as copy or abyss of exemplarity > Derrida doesn’t care if he’s imitating Christ, he wants to save what is left of life

REST.content: everything on trial (tout chose en procès), publicized [re: Shapiro], the proximate cause is a trap: a double that doesn’t make a pair, makes a trap, can’t put one’s feet in them, Christic shade of bait [sole? proper subject? Van Gogh’s surrender?], Christ’s flesh is bait for the Devil (Muscipula Diaboli); in PAS, another type of trap > la paralyse
for Shapiro, parousia of Van Gogh: the shoes are him > hoc est corpus meum, sacrificial offering of his flesh

TR.content: Jean-Jacques puts himself on the cross even as he seems to de-Christianize Augustine
invention of Christ’s Body is an event, even though it’s a discovery of what’s already there

TN.content: flesh (sarx), Nancy’s Corpus is sarcastic, having it out w/ flesh, flesh of Christ
Christianity a religion of blood > beyond point where any religion begins w/ experience of blood
corps-corpse > when Freud lays Psyche on couch is he referring to the Christian body? to say Psyche is “extended,” is to say she remains tangible (against Kant, Descartes)
origin of fetishism [?], desire to touch what touches Jesus’ body (garments), touching w/out touching > made safe, immune, by faith of what touch signifies (not by touch itself)
for Chrétian, Christ is one, common body, not a plurality of bodies > Chrétian & Nancy deal w/ a different “yes,” or a different provenance of same “yes,” addressed to “you”
